complexity_levels: Ultimate detail with every possible aspect

variation_instructions.1: Minimal variation: Only change minor details like colors, small objects, or background elements. Keep main subjects, actions, and setting identical.
variation_instructions.2: Slight variation: Can modify lighting slightly, add/remove small background elements, or make minor changes to secondary subjects.
variation_instructions.3: Moderate variation: Allow changes to lighting, time of day, weather, or add complementary elements that fit the scene naturally.
variation_instructions.4: Some creative freedom: Can change secondary subjects, add new background elements, modify clothing/styles, or adjust the mood slightly.
variation_instructions.5: Balanced creativity: Mix of fidelity and freedom - can change setting details, add new elements, modify character appearances, or adjust composition.
variation_instructions.6: Increased freedom: Can significantly change backgrounds, add new characters/elements, modify the main action slightly, or change the overall mood.
variation_instructions.7: High creativity: Substantial changes allowed - can alter the main setting, change character roles, add dramatic elements, or reinterpret the core concept.
variation_instructions.8: Very high creativity: Major reinterpretations - can change the time period, location completely, character identities, or fundamental story elements.
variation_instructions.9: Extreme creativity: Almost complete departure - can create entirely new narratives, change genres, or make radical conceptual changes while keeping only the vaguest reference.
variation_instructions.10: Maximum creative freedom: Unlimited interpretation - can deviate completely from the original, using only the faintest inspiration from the source material.
